review_title: FCCC: a great place to work!
job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Philadelphia, PA
pros: FCCC is a comprehensive cancer center. There're a lot of great researchers and clinicians here.
cons: I don't have anything particular

pros: A decade ago it would have been easy to list many, but as is often the case, time and change in management have not been kind to this once prestigious institution. There are still fine individuals working at FCCC, but many of the best either already have or are actively looking to depart. Consequently, Philadelphia cancer care has improved at other locations as it has slipped at FCCC (and perhaps it shouldn't amaze anyone that it coincides with the mass migration of their physicians, employees, and support staff).
cons: Low pay, low morale, and across the board reliance on the "Peter principle" at the top-level positions has been the order of the day since Bob Young stepped down as CEO nearly a decade ago. Since that time every major department head has departed, along with the veteran leadership that you would have expected to replace them. Then the nail in the coffin: acquired by Temple.

pros: The PI and other doctors I work for are amazing. Very generous vacation and sick days (although they may try to cut them down after the Temple merger). The new facilities are beautiful.
cons: Some parts of the hospital (especially the infusion area) tend to be run down and not state of the art like most patients are beginning to expect. The salaries are a complete joke. Many departments could pay more, but choose not to.

review_title: Fox Chase Cancer Center no place for an IT professional who values their skills.
pros: Excellent vacation and sick leave allocations of time.  Respectable pension plan along with matching 403b contributions.
cons: Facilities run down.  IT infrastructure extremely lacking in both the capabilities and how up to date it is.  IT is treated as a 3rd class citizen and as nothing more than an expense.  Not treated as a core service vital to the Research and the Hospital.  IT management lives by the mantra of "win by losing". They do not stand up for anything that could be seen as a benefit to IT.  In general an extremely poor environment to be employed in.  Infrastructure Services has had a 50% turnover (14 positions) within 2 years, with more turn over lined up.

pros: Benefits are still pretty good. Longtime employees are still pretty nice. Tuition benefit is great but pay freezes put a damper on things.
cons:
Financially very troubled and don't seem to be making progress. Stealth layoffs continue and morale is shot in every part of the the place. Lots of good people gone within the past two years and upper management knows they will lose more. Keep your resume updated if you work there.

Pay freezes continue. The performance based culture is still too new to say for sure but it looks like they will hose huge percentages of the staff.

job_title: Ambulatory Care Representative in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Full time hours. The best RN's who really care for the patients.  Competitive pay.  No weekends for Ambulatory Care Reps.
cons: Having to accrue vacation time. Not being able to even request time off unless you have it accrued.  Not being able to take time off without pay. Not enough sick time. Penalized for using sick time.  Not necessary for this dept to be open until 6pm. No room for advancement.

review_title: Great Company with a lot of potential
job_title: Nursing Assiatnt (GNA) in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Working at Fox Chase has been a pleasure, the environment is welcoming, I really enjoy helping the people. Its close to where I live so I don't have to worry abut transportation. Overall its a great experience.
cons: Unfortunately the hours I work are at night and I am not able to be with my children. Other then the hours everything else  is fine.

review_title: A nice place to visit, but I wouldn't want to work there ever again.
job_title: Senior Clinical Research Associate in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The job was convenient and it allowed me to gain some valuable oncology experience.  They have a nice cafeteria and gift shop.
cons:
Pay was extremely low.  80% of employees dislike their job and their co-workers, which made it difficult to get through the day with a smile.  Backstabbing is commonplace.  Everyone is out for themselves and can't wait to throw their neighbor under the bus.  

Saw them drop health benefits for 2 employees who got cancer. How ironic is that?

review_title: Better than bedside at many places, but.....
pros: The compensation is below average for bedside nursing but the overall feel of Fox Chase is superior and more personal than most Philadelphia hospitals. Despite the "homey" feel, FC is still cutting edge when it comes to many cancer treatments and research.
cons: Sadly, like all nursing jobs, there is a lack of reality as to what is required for safe and appropriate patient care. The concept of patients' needs being met with the reality of the staffing ratios does not make sense. Unfortunately, there is a serious lack of concern from those in supervisor positions about the reality of what happens on the floor when understaffing has become the norm.

pros: Fox Chase has a worthwhile mission, it was good to be a part of it. There were many nice people and a pleasant working environment. The Medical and Bio-Informatic research was exciting to support. Very nice Cafeteria.
cons: I.T.  is not really respected as a profession at Fox Chase, not  on a par with other 1st-class medical research institutions. IMHO this leads to a negative feedback loop which contributes to the organization's current (2013-2014) financial woes, wherein Research Scientists expecting a world-class IT Infrastructure are disappointed and may leave.

review_title: Good science, obsolete research admin system
pros: Really nice place to do science and nice people to collaborate with.
cons: Paperwork system is still in the 1990s. Enough paperwork to keep you busy for days at some times, especially when trying to order reagents that does not come from contracted vendors.

review_title: I really enjoyed the place and the people
pros: The experience was fantastic.  The people was great, the scientific lectures were very interesting and your colleagues were very intelligent and respectful.
cons: That it is a smaller place and although the people there are top notch, they do not have such a breadth of different research interest.

job_title: Executive Director, Professor, Vice-Chair in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Prestige, nice people, crown jewel of a big health system , helping people in need, life saving, not sure why I have to continue writing more, this is becoming annoying
cons: Very old facility, no innovation, resist changes, not sure why I have to continue writing more, this is becoming annoying

pros: Very helpful Staff, Various benefits offered, room for growth within the institution, average pay rate for administrative staff.
cons: Slow paced accounting office, Constantly looking to cut costs and staff, not consistent with raises or promotions.

review_title: Don't ask, don't tell  seems to be the modus operandi!
pros: Keeping the "big picture" in mind - the work is really for the ones who need it the most, those people who are receving care for health reasons.
cons: Passing the buck; no one wants seems to care about the workers.  The administration seems not to be as important, unless your in the upper management.  Very little accountability, no one specifically is a point person and its easy to ignore the lower ranks.

review_title: the six years at foxchase center i learn a lot done a lot iam on the commitee board.
pros: the  people here as well as the patients are so nice a pleasure.
cons: seeing lots of sick people.especialty if they aare your coworkers

review_title: Overall a good place to work.
pros: Vacation and time off allowance is generous.  Opportunities are provided to offer feedback to the organization.  Has low nurse:patient ratios.
cons: Upper management not forthcoming with information regarding upcoming company changes.  Salaries are below local averages.  Understaffed as most hospitals are.

pros: Until recently, Fox Chase was a great place to work.  It felt like family.  You felt like everyone was working together. Not anymore.
